Rusty Hearts is a great MMORPG game with an awesome soundtrack! Rusty hearts has nice simplistic graphics with a comfortable gearing system. On each stage you can choose your own desired difficulty and playthrough the game according to your standards. You can choose easy, to hack and slash away at enemies no ease OR choose the highest difficulty and engage in a challenging game. If you are a fan of games that look simliar to anime, you should definetly play Rust Hearts! The only problem is, this game is being shut down in September. Hopefully another game provider can pick up this game and find success.

The Pros:
-Unique characters
-Nice Animations
-Great Soundtrack
-Easily obtainable equipment
-Each stage has dungeon difficulty adjustments
-Voice acting isn't bad at all
-Great costumes and customizations
-Big bosses
-Hack and slash button mashing

The Cons:
- Leaning towards the typical MMORPG? (Kinda/Maybe?)

I honestly don't have much to complain about this game, it is a great game. It's just it does have the stereotypical elements of a MMORPG game which might bother people who desire a more unique game.

A hell to get this game working, but when you get it running, it's awesome.

If you are having trouble getting it working, I'll write some tips you can try which me and my friend used when we were trying to get the game working.

reviewText:
Don't even bother downloading this game.

I use to play this game a long time ago. I stopped playing shortly after they released Natasha. Played as her for a little bit, and then stopped playing. Due to time constraints and playing another mmo.
The game then was alright. It was a great way to kill time, but it would get a little tedious at times. You had crafting, tons of quests, tons of monsters to kill, three classes to choose from, and even a cash shop. If you felt like dumping some money into the game.

This time around - I had to fight with the launcher for two days before finally getting the game to boot. The patcher would always get stuck on the same file no matter what I did, and then it wouldn't open back up if I tried to open the launcher after the failed patch. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling the game umpteen amount of times, deleting files, verify integrity of the game, etc etc. I finally get the launcher to fully patch. I get the game working, but with massive bugs trying to get the exe to boot. When I finally get to the login screen, and I try to log in and it keeps telling me my username and password are incorrect even though i've been using this account since the game was released - I created the account specifically for this game. I know my username and password cause I just logged into the website, and I was JUST playing Torchlight 2 with it.
This game has been out since September 2011, and it has this many bugs? That's ridiculous!

If you can get past all of the bull with the launcher, and the login screen. The game is decent. It's a good way to kill time.

The reason why i'm not recommending this game is for several reasons.
- After the initial download of 2gigs on Steam. You still have to download a patch which takes a while, and gives an error which sometimes causes the launcher to redownload the entire patch. -
- The launcher is bugged -
- The log in screen wont recognize my username or password. -
- According to a lot of forum posts, the player base is dwindling. Making leveling harder / impossible in later levels -

TL;DR - Don't bother with this game. Unless they fix it.

reviewText: While certainly not one of the most advanced MMOGs.  And it's one of those Free to Play ones, with a cash shop.  There are so many reasons I could easily NOT recommend this.  However, I am recommending it, I love the game.  The storyline is amusing, the characters are unique, the gameplay is awesome, and playing barbie with the characters is neat, even if you have to pay real life money for some of the nice looking costumes.  I have yet to find a single item in the cash shop that I *needed*.  The game is particularly easy in the beginning, being able to fly through Very Hard mode.  However, it gets harder, to the point where Normal mode becomes somewhat of a challenge.  Also, many of the first dungeouns are very linear, that changes as well.  The dungeouns change as you progress through the storyline as well, as does the NPCs and such.  The group leader also has full control of what dungeoun and difficulty you run at, and it's based on the content the the group leader has unlocked.

reviewText:
Rusty Hearts is basically a 3D anime game where you run around and slaughter monsters by the dozen. It's a fantastic game that can be played with one or two players, up to four. The maximum level is 35, I think. But that indeed, takes a while. You can get burned out on the game if you play too much though, and that's what happened to me after I played for about 2 days straight. Taken in moderation, one could expect to play for a lot longer. The fact this game is free only adds to the awesome, and considering it's the right kind of free, doubly so. It's not a so-called 'Pay-2-Win' game, and all the items gained from spending real money are purely cosmetic. Perfect World Entertainment did very well here, and considering that so far their F2P model has worked so well, I can't wait for their next game.

Pros:
- Free 2 Play
- Solid, responsive controls
- Enjoyable gameplay
- Two playstyles per character

Cons:
- Four different characters
- Repetitive
- Somewhat outdated graphics

A hell to get this game working, but when you get it running, it's awesome.

If you are having trouble getting it working, I'll write some tips you can try which me and my friend used when we were trying to get the game working.

If you like hack 'n' slash games, you need to try this one out. I tried playing with both controller and a little bit with the keyboard and the best is probably if you have a controller to play with. It seems like it's kinda emulates the controller with the keyboard, for example instead of using the joystick on the controller to walk around, you use the arrow keys. I usually don't play these kinda games with a keyboard, so it just felt really weird to me. Might feel better for people used to play with a keybaord, I dunno. You also get a lot of spells, which can be kinda hard to execute with a controller, for example, when you get your 4 first skills they are set on LB, RB, LT and RT. When you get your 5th skill you press B+LT to use it. I just end up not using them very often.

The graphics aren't the best, but it fits. The texture quality and resulotion could be a lot higher. It looks really pixelated and bad when the camera zooms into stuff.

The difficulty settings are really weird as well. I only tried playing with a friend and at least in the beginning of the game, even the hardest difficulty which recommends 3-4 players is completed with ease when we are 2. I hope it becomes more difficult later on...

This games gets 7/10, really fun, but some stuff is just really weird, but hey, it's free!

And now for those who had some problems with the game:

Both me and my friend got stuck in the launcher and got patch errors. To fix this, first close the launcher, then go to your Rusty Hearts installation and open a program called MPatcher.exe". Let it check the stuff and then run the launcher again
date: this time use patch 2 with the little check box. Let it verify and it should run.\n\nIf you get an DirectX error while trying to run the game
recommended: go to your installation folder of Rusty Hearts and there should be a folder with the name of "DirectX_*"
hoursPlayed: for example mine was namned "DirectX_Jun_2010". Open that and run "DXSETUP.exe". Then start the game again and it should work.\n\nAlso

votesHelpful: instead of creating an account in the launcher
votesTotal: create it while in the game on the login screen. There should be a button to register an account there.\n\nThat's all! Have fun!"

Rusty Hearts is by far one of, if not the best MMO I have ever played (though I haven't played terribly many) and is definitely extremely fun. The graphics are visually stunning cell-shaded anime style, with real time hack and slash combat reminiscent of Devil May Cry. The music is superb and so relaxing to listen to, while amping you up during combat and key points. Though the dungeons are rather linear with very little options of free roaming, everything else in the game makes up for it. There are very few areas that needed some work (e.g. some of the dialogue is improper and grammatically incorrect for those that speak English, and for me it seemed like the dialogue in the cut-scenes overlapped eachother 90% of the time making it hard to read along, but my only other complaint is that the game lags at certain points like at the end of a dungeon after killing the boss and waiting for the stats screen to pop up where it shows you how many monsters you killed, what your rank was, how much experience you earned, etc.) But other than that I really can't find any flaws in this game other than the simple fact that it is slowly dying. They still do server maintanance every week which is nice, but there hasn't been any BIG updates to the game in a long time, and nobody really cares about the auction house. You'd be lucky to find 4-5 weapons period out of all of the different types. It seems like the majority of the people that play this game are people who have been playing it since it first came out so there is a lot of veteran players to run into, so making friends and getting accepted into a guild was a rather speedy process and helped make my experience much more enjoyable. I've been hopelessly addicted to this game for the past few weeks. I am having entirely too much fun.

A surprisingly fun little MMO with a hauntingly good main theme song, its not for everyone however. This game forgoes the standard open world thats standard in many MMOs and instead puts the players in a quest hub/city. From there they go to places like the cellar of a home where it spraws out to individual levels where you fight, do quests and level up. The combat itself is simple but pretty fun combat system that uses standard attacks nd special moves that you string into combos. It does lack a character creator, instead the player chooses one character from a small roster to play out their version of the story.\n\nOver all the game is worth a look if you're a fan of action games or MMOs, its certainly not perfect but still could drain your free time if you're not paying attention.

What to say about this game? Let's start with 'I don't recommend it'.

Despite a seemingly charming style and design, and varied, if slightly confusing, gameplay (resembling Devil May Cry / God of War), all mashed into an MMO, as of this current writing moment, this game is utterly broken..

Rampant rollbacks, random economy, unhelpful GMs, overpriced store items, and an utterly ridiculous levelling scheme (the difference between level 41 & 42, might as well be separated by 20 or so levels), just makes this unplayable. In fact, it's more unplayable now than it was on launch.

Even saying all that, it's still a pretty decent game. It's too bad that it seemed to be released 2 years too early.

Oh, and you like that Roselle? Be prepared to shell out $20 for her.

This is so far the best RPG (Dungeon) series I've played. There's four default characters, Frantz, Angela, Tude, Natasha; others require Zen to be played. It starts off with the storyline of Frantz and Angela. As you get deeper into the game, stories of friendship, love, hatred are shown. Hunting for equipments in this game is fairly easy, considering the rate of getting unique items. This server runs in NA West, NA East, and EU. Asia players might have a hard time finding parties. The cel-shaded graphics is also one keyed feature in upcoming games, and the technology of using Nvidia 3D Vision to play this game. The gameplay is great and dumb-proof, hack-and-slash.

However there are still known bugs in the game, such as (leader being switched after exiting dungeon, loadbar isn't responding if partied with high-ping players, items aren't looted/sold even though the sound is played). Nevertheless, this game is worth to download.

This game is FAR too exciting for me. All the dainty piano music while navigating mazes of invisible walls (whoa! go AROUND the lamp post please. No short-cuts or walking on sidewalks!) perfectly complements the primary goal of reading a novel's worth of suspense-filled dialog.

Excerpt:
Me: Hi!
*click*
Emo guy: ...
*click*
Emo guy: Hi
*click*
Me: Who are you?
*click*
Emo guy: ...
*click*
Emo guy: Who's asking?
*click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click**click*
Emo guy: I'm the blacksmith.

AAAAAAAGGGGGH! Why do writers of anime games do their damnedest to make every conversation a complete pain in the ♥♥♥?! Do this:

Me: Hi! Who are you?
Emo dude: Bah, I'm annoyed and emo. Now that we have that out of the way, I'm also the blacksmith. You can buy blacksmithy ♥♥♥♥ from me. Oh, while I'm at it here's a quest. Press X to buy ♥♥♥♥, Y to accept the quest or Z to leave and uninstall this game.

That wonderful dialogue, the carefully balanced and fleshed-out characters (which are not at ALL cut and paste anime clichés!) and relationships, the beautiful animations and HD graphics (har har), the incredibly dynamic and tactical fights with mobs of monsters (no two of which ever look alike and with superhuman AI)... it's too much. I could go on but the staggering quality of this game can't be put into words. The game seems to mock you by draping its top-tier Asian lounge-rock music over you while you battle ceaselessly against the weight of your eyelids, using one hand to click on monster after monster and navigate through square passages and the other to drink coffee or clean your nose. It gets a massive 8-star rating out of at least 100!

The makers really nailed the genre. Boobs, spikey hair, characters that act like either children or moody teenagers, mundane ♥♥♥♥ to click on, all peppered with plenty of empty stares and slow, slow, slow, little snippets of dragged-out conversation - it's the perfect recipe for an Earth-shattering anime MMORPG! This one is absolutely perfect. No one ever needs to make another. Really. Don't make any more of these. Please, please don't.
